TopicTitle: One wheel, SAS stablised rovers. In real life.

Articles.Content:
Turns out its not just a kerbal thing.

http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/4422853/onewheel-the-self-balancing-electric-skateboard

Like a scateboard meets segway.

My birthday is in April... anyone?

Edited January 13, 2014 by Tw1

yea ive seen tech like this before

theres the RYNO a one weel electric motorcycle and another motorised unicicle that i dont remember its name but it was red

and another thats just a weel with step pads on it and segways are the granddaddys of them all

and now this

i see another vehicle market coming in fast

I own a segway !

And I am in loose contact with the inventor of the RYNO . He came to my College ( oregon tech ) and we had a very nice chat about his system . He was looking for summer help for batts .... ended up nabbing a PSU student .

VIDEO of the same Seg

Please pardon the batman suit . It was halloween last Year .

The RYNO and Seg have a non spinning Gyro called a MEMS sensor . same kind used in a WiiMote and a Ipad.

The MEMS sends data to the Main CPU and It then has a IMU of sorts to then control the PWM to the Drive motors .

As fun as they are to drive , I have one as I cant drive a car and I have Really bad knees so no bike .....

Edited January 12, 2014 by Peter KG6LSE

That's a cool video, the swishing cape adds to the effect. Segways and batman are a good mix.

If I could afford one of these things, I'd be the coolest guy at uni. And it'd save me some effort, my uni's on a steep site.

Edit: Bob has a segway now.

Edited January 13, 2014 by Tw1

HA! now I SO need to add that to my Mun lander next flight . .

I was gonna head to bed . naw Iam gonna make me a KerWay tonight !

Segway makes a robotics platform " SMRP "
Just saw a segway up close in real life for the first time. Camera man outside the Sydney Cricket Ground. Thought I'd post about it.

Just saw a segway up close in real life for the first time. Camera man outside the Sydney Cricket Ground. Thought I'd post about it.

Saw one in a train station.

Saw one in a train station.

Makes sense. No needed to find a parking spot, just stand it up next to you.

I reckon the skateboard thing would be even easier though, especially if can go reasonable distances and charges fast, like they claim.

Why screw around with wimpy little electric vehicles?

Problem is the quick stops usually end up in a face plant on a monowheel.

I'd much prefer a pulse jet engined bicycle...much safer.
